Event.name: Immobilization
Event.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> immobilizes a <fen>Patient</fen> optionally, to an <fen>Anchor</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The junior officer</fex> <t>handcuffed</t> <fex name="Patient">his commanding officer</fex> <fex name="Anchor">to his desk</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> immobilizes the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">Lisa</fex> <t>handcuffed</t> Mike to the refridgerator.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The instrument with which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> is immobilized by the <fen>Agent</fen>, optionally to an <fen>Anchor</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the immobilization.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> immobilizes a <fen>Patient</fen>.
<ex>Lisa <t>handcuffed</t> Mike to the refridgerator <fex name="Purp">to reduce the mess</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Anchor
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> attaches the <fen>Patient</fen> to an <fen>Anchor</fen>, generally, an immobile object. Lisa <t>handcuffed</t> Mike <fex name="Anchor">to the refridgerator</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Patient</fen> is immobilized as a result.
<ex>The policman <t>tied</t> <t>up</t> the burglar <fex name="Degree">completely</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the immobilizing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). This FE also covers expressions that indicate salient characteristics of the Agent which also affect the action (carefully, eagerly).
<ex>Brian grabbed Kim's arm and <t>handcuffed</t> him <fex name="Manner">quickly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: lock up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make or become rigidly fixed or immovable by locking
